thread.title: Zedd plays not-so-secret Las Vegas show for re:Invent conference
thread.title_full: Zedd plays not-so-secret Las Vegas show for re:Invent conference | Las Vegas Review-Journal

author: Dave Herrera
title: Zedd plays not-so-secret Las Vegas show for re:Invent conference
text:
Amazon Web Services kicked off its annual re:Invent conference earlier this week here in Las Vegas, which attracted a throng of techies from across the country.
Last night, organizers threw a huge party for attendees in the shadow of the Highroller in the space behind the Linq and Harrahs. From the photos being shared today, it looks like it was one heck of a shindig.
Zedd, the 26-year-old dance music producer otherwise known as Anton Zaslavski, was tapped to perform a (not so) secret set. Taking time off of his current True Colors tour, which resumes tonight in State College, Penn., the EDM maestro thrilled those assembled by throwing down a two-hour set.
Best seat in the house #aws #reinvent #replay pic.twitter.com/Vu2313SjlS 
Â— Werner Vogels (@Werner) October 9, 2015 Cumberbatch's 'Hamlet'... Here are the set times for...
